contentencoded: Facebook made a big announcement yesterday, but it wasn't the one some observers of the company were expecting. The social media giant is breaking into the search game with a new product called Graph Search, and it's getting the attention of the company's Silicon Valley rivals. And, Governor Jerry Brown of California tells Marketplace how he balanced California's notoriously deficit-ridden
title: Marketplace Morning Report for Wednesday, January 16, 2013
description: Facebook made a big announcement yesterday, but it wasn't the one some observers of the company were expecting. The social media giant is breaking into the search game with a new product called Graph Search, and it's getting the attention of the company's Silicon Valley rivals. And, Governor Jerry Brown of California tells Marketplace how he balanced California's notoriously deficit-ridden budget.
teaser: Facebook made a big announcement yesterday, but it wasn't the one some observers of the company were expecting. And, Governor Jerry Brown of California tells Marketplace how he balanced California's notoriously deficit-ridden budget.
byline: Jeremy Hobson, Queena Kim, Rupert Wingfield-Hayes, Sally Herships, Mitchell Hartman and Mark Garrison
